business.headline: Crisis brews at Bira 91: How a name change shook the popular beer brandFrom beer icon to regulatory nightmare, Bira 91's journey shows how a minor administrative tweak can spiral into financial chaos, employee unrest, and investor anxiety.

LG Electronics vs Tata Capital IPO: What should be your strategy post-listing?Two IPOs, two very different strategies. Tata Capital offers steady long-term growth, while LG Electronics promises quick listing gains. Read on to plan post-listing moves and investment approach carefully.

LG Electronics IPO allotment is finally out. How much listing gain you can expect?Investors who received allotments may be sitting on potential listing gains of Rs 5,000–Rs 6,000 per lot, depending on market sentiment at the time of debut.

Anil Ambani aide and senior Reliance Power executive arrested by EDThe arrest of Ashok Pal, who serves as the executive director at Reliance Power, is related to a suspected fake bank guarantee racket worth Rs 68.2 crore.

Tata History: When Nehru, Jinnah, and Bose allied to save steel companyStarting as a company trading in cotton and opium, the Tata Group has weathered colonial economic warfare, nationalist politics, labor upheaval, and insurgent crises. But it has always emerged stronger through vision, sacrifice, and resilience. In the final episode of our series on the group, we revisit two storms that threatened to sink the Tata brand and image.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as financial stocks rally; Cipla, SBI among top gainersSensex ends 328 points higher, Nifty above 25,250; Cipla, SBI lead gains

Convenience or debt trap? The hidden cost of BPNL, easy credit and festive offersEvery festive season, easy credit makes everything—from gadgets to holidays—look affordable. But behind the glitter of BNPL schemes and "no-cost EMIs" lies a growing debt trap that's quietly eroding financial freedom.

Tata Trusts trustee Vijay Singh calls internal rift unprecedented: ReportVijay Singh, who serves as a trustee and vice-chairman of Tata Trusts, said that the act of voting on internal matters went against the long-standing principles followed during Ratan Tata's leadership.

WeWork India slips 5% in debut trade amid valuation, governance concernsCorporate governance firm InGovern warned investors of WeWork India's fragile financials, negative cash flow, high lease liabilities, and the absence of fresh capital infusion.

Buy, borrow, die: The wealth cheat code the rich don't share, explains CAEver wondered how wealthy families keep growing their wealth while others struggle with taxes and inflation? CA reveals a simple three-step strategy: Buy, Borrow, Die. Have a look.

LG Electronics IPO GMP touches Rs 400: Here's how to check allotment statusLG IPO: The GMP is an indicator of market sentiment, showing the expected difference between the IPO price and the likely listing price. With the upper price band set at Rs 1,140, a GMP of Rs 400 suggests the shares could debut at around Rs 1,540, implying potential listing gains of roughly 35%.
TCS reports 20,000 layoffs, employees' advocacy group questions transparencyThe IT giant's employee strength fell from 6,13,069 on June 30 to 5,93,314, according to Q2FY26 data posted on its website.

Stopping PF contributions? What it means for your retirement savingsPausing your PF contributions may seem harmless, but it can slow down your retirement savings. Even if your money stays safe, missing deposits could mean losing valuable interest and tax benefits over time.

What's brewing at Bira 91? Over 250 employees seek removal of founder, says reportEmployees cited "corporate governance failure, lack of transparency, delays in salaries and dues," as well as cases filed by creditors indicating deteriorating financials and pending vendor payments.

Tata Capital IPO vs LG IPO GMP: Which one is likely to give better returns? Tata Capital's IPO, priced between Rs 310–Rs 326, shows modest grey market premiums of Rs 6–Rs 7, indicating limited listing gains. LG Electronics India's IPO, at Rs 1,140, boasts Rs 380 GMP, suggesting strong upside.

Bitcoin slips again. 3 reasons why the crypto market is downBitcoin's price has slipped again this week, signalling renewed volatility in the digital asset space. From rising US inflation worries to ETF outflows, here's what's dragging crypto prices lower.

The legacy of Tata Trusts, beyond the boardroomTata Trusts is one of India's oldest, largest, and most influential philanthropic foundations.  A group of public charitable trusts set up by members of the Tata family, the present-day Trusts trace their origin to the working-class-focused JN Endowment Fund, started by Jamsetji Tata.
Sensex, Nifty trade higher after flat start as banks lead gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 232.01 points to 82,404.11, while the NSE Nifty50 added 70.60 points to 25,252.40 as of 9:32 am.

UK PM Keir Starmer calls Paytm the 'Superstar' of Indian fintech industryUK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said that the rise of Indian fintech companies on the world stage driven by technological innovation, digital inclusion, and entrepreneurial scale.

LG Electronics IPO allotment live: Check status online, GMP surges ahead of listingLG Electronics IPO closed for bidding on Thursday, created a record by attracting bids worth Rs 4.4 lakh crore, making it the most subscribed IPO in India by value.

entertainment.headline: Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan dies due to heart complications Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan, who was also a police officer, has died. Maan's songs often reflected the traditions of rural Punjab.

Exclusive: Gulshan Devaiah on Kannada debut, Bhoota Kola, self-belief and more Actor Gulshan Devaiah, who was recently seen in 'Kantara: Chapter 1', exclusively spoke to IndiaToday.in about his experience working with Rishab Shetty, witnessing the Bhoota Kola tradition in Karnataka, his message for outsiders in the film industry, and more.

Ajay Devgn's De De Pyaar De sequel gets a release date. Check poster The sequel to 'De De Pyaar De' finally has a release date. Actor Ajay Devgn on Saturday shared the first motion poster of the upcoming film and hinted at the plot.

Felt like dream: Saira Banu recalls wedding with Dilip Kumar on 59th anniversary On their 59th wedding anniversary, veteran actor Saira Banu reminisced about her wedding night with late actor Dilip Kumar, calling it a dreamlike and joy-filled evening. She fondly recalled the simplicity, chaos, and heartfelt moments that made the day unforgettable.

Amitabh Bachchan turns 83: Prabhas to Farhan Akhtar, celebs share birthday wishes Bollywood legend Amitabh Bachchan turned 83 today, with celebrities like Shatrughan Sinha, Farhan Akhtar, Prabhas, and Srijit Mukherji sharing heartfelt birthday wishes for the megastar.

Creating something with Allu Arjun, reveals Atlee Director Atlee, said his upcoming film with Allu Arjun will be something very new, very intriguing, addictive to watch, promising a visually striking and innovative experience. The high-profile project, tentatively titled 'AA22 x A6', also stars Deepika Padukone, with speculation about other big names joining the cast.

Kareena Kapoor shares Taimur chooses sports over acting: He has no clue about actors Kareena Kapoor shared that her son Taimur Ali Khan has no interest in acting and prefers sports and other activities instead. Despite being the child of Bollywood superstars, Taimur is exploring his own passions at school.

Fans pull Billie Eilish into crowd during Miami concert, safely rescued by security During her Miami concert on October 9, Billie Eilish was pulled into the crowd by a fan but was quickly rescued by security and continued her performance. The incident left the singer visibly shaken, highlighting ongoing safety concerns she has faced in recent years.

Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Nandhini walks out after full-blown meltdown  'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 contestant Nandhini exited the show after a meltdown, citing her inability to act or play along for content. Her departure left both contestants and fans emotional, with many praising her for prioritising her mental health.

Rashmika shares glimpse of ring amid engagement buzz with Vijay Deverakonda Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are engaged and planning to marry in February 2026, following an intimate ceremony in Hyderabad. Rashmika recently shared the first glimpse of her engagement ring, delighting fans and subtly confirming the news.

Diwali 2025 box office: The lights are on, but where are the biggies? As Diwali 2025 lights up theatres across India, Bollywood bets on 'Thamma', 'Ek Deewane Ki Deewaniyat', and 'Mahayoddha Rama', while the South stays unusually silent. Trade experts decode how the festival's once-guaranteed box office magic is evolving -- from star-driven spectacles to content-led cinema -- and what the changing festive calendar means for India's biggest movie season.

Akshay Kumar's Teri Mitti performance wins hearts at Gujarat event. Watch Akshay Kumar moved audiences with a performance of 'Teri Mitti' at 'Mera Desh Pehle' event in Gujarat. Dressed in traditional attire, he left a lasting impact with his emotional tribute to India.

Happy Birthday Amitabh Bachchan: How the icon stays relevant in the era of Gen Z Amitabh Bachchan turns 83 on October 11. A look at how the legend of cinema has seamlessly moved from his larger-than-life image of yore to one of the biggest phenomena on Indian reality TV

Kantara Chapter 1 box office Day 9: Rishab's film surpasses Rs 350 crore in India Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1' continues its dream run, crossing Rs 350 crore in India and Rs 500 crore worldwide. The film regained momentum in its second week, with strong occupancy across all languages and regions.

A love letter to Kantara Chapter 1: An unforgettable theatrical experience 'Kantara Chapter 1' has grossed over Rs 500 crore at the worldwide box office. But for those who truly loved the film, it means more than just pride in the number — it's about the emotions the film leaves you with.

Decoding Karan Johar's Homebound question: What's theatre-worthy anymore? After 'Homebound's' critical acclaim but box office failure, Karan Johar reflected on whether passion-driven cinema still has space in theatres. IndiaToday.in spoke to trade experts who weighed in on the balance between art and commerce, the changing post-pandemic audience, and what makes a film "theatre-worthy" today.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 48: Kunickaa gets candid on romance, Nehal wins captaincy After a twist in this week's captaincy task, Nehal Chudasama became the new captain of 'Bigg Boss 19'. Meanwhile, Kunickaa Sadanand opened up about her love life and Gaurav Khanna won a car.

Priyanka-Nick to Ayushmann-Tahira, here's how Bollywood celebrated Karwa Chauth Celebrity couples like Priyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas, Ayushmann Khurrana and Tahira Kashyap, shared Karwa Chauth photos. Check out their special moments.

Alia likely to join Prabhas's Kalki 2898 AD sequel after Deepika's exit: Report Actor Alia Bhatt is reportedly in advanced discussions to join the sequel of 'Kalki 2898 AD'. The makers had earlier cited creative and commitment differences for actor Deepika Padukone's exit from the film.

general news.headline: Odisha medical student raped on Bengal hospital premises, slugfest eruptsThe incident in Bengal's Durgapur, the biggest industrial hub of the state, is reminiscent of the 2024 RG Kar case where a junior doctor was raped and murdered, triggering nationwide outrage.

Senior Haryana cop sacked after being named in IPS officer suicide caseSenior Haryana cop Narendra Bijarniya was removed after being named in IPS officer Y Puran Kumar's suicide case, which has triggered nationwide outrage and demands for justice from political and Dalit groups.

Will face same fate as Rahul Gandhi did in Amethi: PK's warning to TejashwiRaghopur has historically been dominated by the Yadav family, with Lalu Prasad Yadav and Rabri Devi having won multiple terms and served as Chief Ministers of Bihar.

Had no role: Government after women journalists barred at Taliban presserThe government clarified it had no role in the Taliban press conference in Delhi where women journalists were barred, sparking outrage over gender bias and India's image.

I will protect Shubman Gill, unfair things have been said about him: Gautam GambhirHead coach Gautam Gambhir backed Shubman Gill, praising the 25-year-old for handling pressure with composure during India's England tour. Gambhir said Gill had passed his toughest test as captain and promised to support him fully, highlighting the young leader's strong start.

NDA holds crucial Bihar seat-sharing talks, Jitan Ram Manjhi upset with formulaSenior NDA leaders from Bihar have converged in Delhi for crucial discussions on seat sharing. The outcome of these talks will shape the alliance's electoral strategy and candidate selection for the upcoming state assembly polls.

Pak bleeds as Islamist group's march turns violent, 11 dead in police firingThe protests by Tehreek-i-Labbaik Pakistan, which began against the killings in Gaza by Israel, turned violent as the agitators clashed with police. It paralysed life in Islamabad and Rawalpindi for a second day.

What's Tehreek-e-Labbaik, Pak army's proxy that's taken nation hostage?Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP), an extremist Islamist group, has repeatedly held Pakistan hostage through violent protests. The TLP is a proxy of the military regime and has been used by it to shape political outcomes. It held violent protests in Lahore that killed two, and forced the fortification of Islamabad.

Tollywood actor's abusive remarks on Gandhi go viral, sparks outrageThe clip, which also contains references to Nathuram Godse, has drawn widespread condemnation from political leaders and civil society groups, with many demanding an apology from the actor.

From Taipei to Kalinga: Parth Singh's run for India, the legacy of Tyson GayLiving in Taipei but representing India, Parth Singh impressed at the National Junior Championships in Kalinga, winning the U20 100m and qualifying for the long jump final. Inspired by Tyson Gay, the 18-year-old balances dual events while aiming for the World Championships and keeping his Olympic dreams in sight.

This is what happened when Bengaluru woman asked for WFH after mother's accidentA woman working at an IT firm in Bengaluru asked her company to allow her to work from home after her mother met with an accident. The company asked for proof and then denied her request. Read on:

West Indies fight better, but India well ahead after Shubman Gill specialIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test:** West Indies produced their best batting display of the tour, but they remained 378 runs behind at stumps on Day 2. Captain Shubman Gill scored an unbeaten 129, while Ravindra Jadeja took three wickets to keep India firmly in control.
Inside the world of India's 'hidden' barsCalled speakeasies, hidden bars are fuelling India's latest F&B obsession - a taste for mystery on the menu. Delhi, especially, has no shortage of them.

India needs an FDA-style drug regulator — NowIndia's recurring drug scandals expose deep cracks in its regulatory framework. From contaminated syrups to inconsistent quality checks, the country urgently needs a strong, independent FDA-like body to ensure medicine safety and restore public trust.

Rahul Gandhi also fights for democracy: Congress leader's post on Nobel Peace PrizeThe Congress has long maintained that Rahul Gandhi is fighting against the "dictatorship" of the NDA government as he has, taken on the ruling dispensation over several key issues.

Why the 30-30-3 method can be the ultimate gut hack you needAnother day, another wellness trend on the block, and this one's for a happy gut. As gut health takes on the wellness world, the 30-30-3 framework might just be the hack you didn't know you needed.

Is the Nobel Peace Prize too political? Controversial winners over the yearsThe 2025 Peace Prize to María Corina Machado has revived old arguments about politics and the Nobel Peace Prize. Here's a list of the controversial Peace Prize laureates and why each choice drew criticism.

Women caught travelling without tickets hurl casteist remarks at TTE. Video goes viralA video of two women arguing with a ticket checker and making casteist remarks at him after being caught travelling in a First AC coach has gone viral on social media.

Strict security, limited media: Vijay to meet Karur victim families on October 17Actor-turned-politician Vijay is set to meet families affected by the Karur tragedy on October 17. The visit will be tightly secured with strict crowd control measures to ensure order and safety.

Confirmed, TCS has cut nearly 20,000 jobs in recent layoffs: Story in 5 pointsTCS has executed its steepest-ever layoffs, reducing its workforce below 6 lakh employees in the last 3 months. The cuts reflect pressures from AI adoption and uncertain US trade policies affecting India's IT industry.

Punjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan dies due to heart complicationsPunjabi folk singer Gurmeet Singh Maan, who was also a police officer, has died. Maan's songs often reflected the traditions of rural Punjab.

Amitabh Bachchan greets fans outside Jalsa on his 83rd birthdayOn his 83rd birthday on Saturday, megastar Amitabh Bachchan thanked fans for their love and support with folded hands outside his residence in Mumbai. Watch.

sports.headline: Watch: Nat Sciver-Brunt dedicates century to newborn with cradle celebration Nat Sciver-Brunt stole the spotlight with a heartwarming 'Bebeto' baby-rocking celebration for her newborn after scoring her 26th ODI century against Sri Lanka in the Women's World Cup.

Jadeja praises Shubman Gill, Yashasvi Jaiswal: Young generation taking responsibility Ravindra Jadeja heaped praise on Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal after their hundreds in the ongoing Delhi Test against West Indies. Jaiswal and Gill's hundreds helped India post a mammoth total of 518 runs in the first innings of the second Test.

Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given captaincy: Anil Kumble Legendary India leg spinner Anil Kumble has said that Shubman Gill has shown great composure after being given the India captaincy. Gill scored his fifth century as skipper on Day 2 of the second Test against West Indies at Arun Jaitley in Delhi.

Alyssa Healy pins hopes on trump card Sophie Molineux to deliver vs India Alyssa Healy expects Sophie Molineux to play a key role as Australia take on India in Sunday's Women's World Cup clash in Vizag. Australia, atop the points table, hope to leverage favourable conditions and a sold-out crowd for an exciting contest.

Compete against yourself: Neeraj Chopra gets key advice from Olympic legend Carl Lewis Olympic legend Carl Lewis advised Neeraj Chopra to start competing against himself to remain on top of the world. Neeraj had an up and down season in 2025 as he lost his crown at the World Athletics Championships.

Exclusive: Avani Lekhara On Para-Athletics In India & Her Training For Upcoming World Cup In this India Today special report, star para-shooter Avani Lekhara discusses her recent ramp walk in Delhi, secret preparations for the 2026 season, and managing the pressure of expectations. On the nervousness that comes with being a top athlete, Lekhara stated, 'second Paralympics was much tougher than the first one and I think it will be same for him as well and we were going with a lot of expectations and there was nervousness, there was jitters...'. She reveals she is training for an upcoming World Cup in the UAE this month. Lekhara also details a significant overhaul of her equipment, including a new rifle and shooting wheelchair, as she prepares for the 2026 Asian Para Games and World Para Shooting Championships. She shares her perspective on the growth of para-sports in India, following the country's record medal haul at the recent World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi.

Arshad's coach slams Pak athletics body, says relied on friend's financial aid Arshad Nadeem finished a disappointing 10th in the World Athletics Championships men's javelin final in Tokyo in September. The Pakistan Sports Board demanded an explanation from the Olympic champion for the dismal show.

Ravindra Jadeja breaks silence on Australia ODI snub: Want to play World Cup 2027 Ravindra Jadeja broke his silence on being snubbed from India's squad for the upcoming ODI series against Australia and said he still hopes to be a part of the World Cup 2027. Jadeja was part of India's squad in the Champions Trophy.

India troubled by left-arm spinners in World Cup? Sneh Rana plays down concerns Sneh Rana played down concerns over India's struggles against left-arm spin, expressing confidence that the team's experienced batters will bounce back strongly. On Sunday, India will face Australia in Vizag.

Under-fire Pratika Rawal trains hard as India gear up for Australia test in Vizag Women's World Cup: After three solid starts in the group stage, Pratika Rawal worked hard in the nets on the eve of the big-ticket clash against Australia. India had an optional training sesssion before Sneh Rana addressed the press in Visakhapatnam on Saturday.

Exclusive: Carl Lewis Backs India's 2036 Olympic Bid, Offers Advice For Neeraj Chopra In this exclusive conversation, India Today speaks with nine-time Olympic gold medalist Carl Lewis, who was in Delhi as the international ambassador for the Delhi Half Marathon. Lewis shares his strong support for India's 2036 Olympic bid and gives his expert advice to two-time Olympic medalist Neeraj Chopra. When asked what it takes to stay at the top, Lewis stated, 'what happens when you become number one in the world, you no longer competing against the world, you're competing against yourself.' The athletic icon also discusses the infrastructure and national unity required for a successful Olympic Games, his experience walking the ramp for a cause, and the importance of sustainability and youth sports programs for the country's future.

World Para gold-winner Simran Sharma's medal in danger as guide faces doping banWorld Para gold-winner Simran Sharma faces the risk of losing her medals after her guide Umar Saifi was provisionally suspended for doping. The incident has sent shockwaves through Indian para athletics.

World-class Babar Azam's wicket will be big one for South Africa: Aiden MarkramDespite his poor recent run of form, Aiden Markram feels that Babar Azam will be the key wicket for his side in the upcoming series between Pakistan and South Africa. Babar hasn't scored an international hundred since August 30, 2023.

Love you Shubman Gill: Fan goes viral after proposing to India captain in Delhi TestIndian captain Shubman Gill stole the spotlight both on and off the field during the second Test against the West Indies in Delhi, going viral after a fan held up a "I love you Shubman" placard.

I will protect Shubman Gill, unfair things have been said about him: Gautam GambhirHead coach Gautam Gambhir backed Shubman Gill, praising the 25-year-old for handling pressure with composure during India's England tour. Gambhir said Gill had passed his toughest test as captain and promised to support him fully, highlighting the young leader's strong start.

Shubman Gill surpasses Rohit, equals MS Dhoni with 5th century as Test captainIndia vs West Indies, 2nd Test: Shubman Gill brought up his fifth hundred as Test captain, continuing his golden run with the bat in red-ball cricket. The 25-year-old went past the likes of Rahul Dravid and Rohit Sharma on the list of Indian captains with most hundreds in Tests.

New Zealand defeat was a shock, still very close to my heart: Gautam GambhirIND vs WI: Gautam Gambhir said that he doesn't want India to forget their hammering at the hands of New Zealand. Last year, the Kiwis whitewashed India 3-0 in the three-match Test series.

Are India missing the Shafali Verma firepower amid batting woes?Women's World Cup: India's batting options are limited, yet they chose to overlook Shafali Verma for the mega event. On Thursday, India tasted their first defeat in Vizag at the hands of Laura Wolvaardt's South Africa.

Garry Kasparov beats old rival Vishy Anand, exceeds own expectations at 62Garry Kasparov defeated Viswanathan Anand 13–11 at the Clutch Chess: The Legends exhibition in St Louis. The 62-year-old expressed surprise at his own performance but stopped short of declaring a comeback. The event reunited the two former rivals, 30 years after their World Championships match in New York.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
